content:
I was attempting to define the permutation of terms that could be used to prove the Riemann Series Theorem. This permutation is defined inductively, and in each step a natural number corresponding to the smallest nonnegative or negative term (depending on the sum up to this point) is returned. I use nat.find, which requires an existence proof.
I would like to be able to use this existence proof both inside and outside of the definition of the recursive function. The simplest way to do this is just to copy and paste the proofs outside the definition, which is not too bad in this case because the proofs are only about 5 lines each. However, in general, is there a better way of doing this that doesn't require duplicating the proof?

Here's what the definition looks like currently:

import topology.algebra.ring.basic
import algebra.big_operators.basic
import order.filter.at_top_bot
import analysis.specific_limits.normed
import topology.metric_space.cau_seq_filter
import tactic
open filter
open_locale big_operators topology

universe u

def partial_sum {R : Type u} [add_comm_monoid R] (f : â„• â†’ R) (n : â„•) := âˆ‘ i in finset.range n, f i

noncomputable def rearrangement {a : â„• â†’ â„}
  (hâ‚ : âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum a) at_top (ğ“ C))
  (hâ‚‚ : Â¬âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum (Î» n, â€–a nâ€–)) at_top (ğ“ C)) (M : â„) : â„• â†’ â„•
| 0 := 0
| (n+1) :=
  if âˆ‘ (x : fin (n + 1)) in finset.univ, a (rearrangement â†‘x) â‰¤ M then
    have h : âˆƒ k, k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement â†‘x) âˆ§ 0 â‰¤ a k := sorry,
    nat.find h
  else
    have h : âˆƒ k, k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement â†‘x) âˆ§ a k < 0 := sorry,
    nat.find h

lemma exists_nonneg_terms_not_in_range_fin_rearrangement {a : â„• â†’ â„}
  (hâ‚ : âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum a) at_top (ğ“ C))
  (hâ‚‚ : Â¬âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum (Î» n, â€–a nâ€–)) at_top (ğ“ C)) (M : â„) (n : â„•)
  : âˆƒ k, k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement hâ‚ hâ‚‚ M â†‘x) âˆ§ 0 â‰¤ a k := sorry

lemma exists_neg_terms_not_in_range_fin_rearrangement {a : â„• â†’ â„}
  (hâ‚ : âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum a) at_top (ğ“ C))
  (hâ‚‚ : Â¬âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum (Î» n, â€–a nâ€–)) at_top (ğ“ C)) (M : â„) (n : â„•)
  : âˆƒ k, k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement hâ‚ hâ‚‚ M â†‘x) âˆ§ a k < 0 := sorry

Here's my current attempt to do this with mutual definitions, which currently gives the message ill-formed match/equations expression

mutual def rearrangement, exists_nonneg, exists_neg
  {a : â„• â†’ â„}
  (hâ‚ : âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum a) at_top (ğ“ C))
  (hâ‚‚ : Â¬âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum (Î» n, â€–a nâ€–)) at_top (ğ“ C)) (M : â„)
with rearrangement : â„• â†’ â„•
| 0 := 0
| (n+1) :=
  if âˆ‘ (x : fin (n + 1)) in finset.univ, a (rearrangement â†‘x) â‰¤ M then
    have h : âˆƒ k, k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement â†‘x) âˆ§ 0 â‰¤ a k := sorry,
    nat.find h
  else
    have h : âˆƒ k, k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement â†‘x) âˆ§ a k < 0 := sorry,
    nat.find h
with exists_nonneg : âˆ€ n : â„•, âˆƒ k, k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement â†‘x) âˆ§ 0 â‰¤ a k
| n := sorry
with exists_neg : âˆ€ n : â„•, âˆƒ k, k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement â†‘x) âˆ§ a k â‰¤ 0
| n := sorry

Since your definition is noncomputable, you don't need to use nat.find (which is a specific algorithm for computing an infimum) and you can use Inf instead, which also defaults to 0 if the set is empty so it avoids your needing to provide an existence proof to use it.

Something like this (untested):

noncomputable def rearrangement {a : â„• â†’ â„}
  (hâ‚ : âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum a) at_top (ğ“ C))
  (hâ‚‚ : Â¬âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum (Î» n, â€–a nâ€–)) at_top (ğ“ C)) (M : â„) : â„• â†’ â„•
| 0 := 0
| (n+1) :=
  if âˆ‘ x : fin (n + 1), a (rearrangement â†‘x) â‰¤ M then
    Inf {k | k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement â†‘x) âˆ§ 0 â‰¤ a k}
  else
    Inf {k | k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement â†‘x) âˆ§ a k < 0}

There's docs#nat.Inf_def if you need to convert between Inf and nat.find in proofs.

That's a good idea. One advantage of it is that I can now remove the h1 and h2 from the definition (since I know that complicated hypotheses in definitions are sometimes discouraged). In general I guess I could also just use an if statement and prove outside the function that the if statement will never be false.

I think it worked. Here are the revised definitions. They are a bit long but I don't really know how to shorten them.

noncomputable def rearrangement (a : â„• â†’ â„) (M : â„) : â„• â†’ â„•
| 0 := 0
| (n+1) :=
  if âˆ‘ (x : fin (n + 1)) in finset.univ, a (rearrangement â†‘x) â‰¤ M then
    Inf {k : â„• | k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement â†‘x) âˆ§ 0 â‰¤ a k}
  else
    Inf {k : â„• | k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement â†‘x) âˆ§ a k < 0}

lemma exists_nonneg_terms_not_in_range_fin_rearrangement {a : â„• â†’ â„}
  (hâ‚ : âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum a) at_top (ğ“ C))
  (hâ‚‚ : Â¬âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum (Î» n, â€–a nâ€–)) at_top (ğ“ C)) (M : â„) (n : â„•)
  : âˆƒ k, k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement a M â†‘x) âˆ§ 0 â‰¤ a k := sorry

lemma exists_neg_terms_not_in_range_fin_rearrangement {a : â„• â†’ â„}
  (hâ‚ : âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum a) at_top (ğ“ C))
  (hâ‚‚ : Â¬âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum (Î» n, â€–a nâ€–)) at_top (ğ“ C)) (M : â„) (n : â„•)
  : âˆƒ k, k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement a M â†‘x) âˆ§ a k < 0 := sorry

lemma rearrangement_def {a : â„• â†’ â„}
  (hâ‚ : âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum a) at_top (ğ“ C))
  (hâ‚‚ : Â¬âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum (Î» n, â€–a nâ€–)) at_top (ğ“ C)) (M : â„) (n : â„•)
  : rearrangement a M (n + 1) =
    if âˆ‘ (x : fin (n + 1)) in finset.univ, a (rearrangement a M â†‘x) â‰¤ M then
      have h : âˆƒ k, k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement a M â†‘x) âˆ§ 0 â‰¤ a k,
      from exists_nonneg_terms_not_in_range_fin_rearrangement hâ‚ hâ‚‚ M n,
      nat.find h
    else
      have h : âˆƒ k, k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement a M â†‘x) âˆ§ a k < 0,
      from exists_neg_terms_not_in_range_fin_rearrangement hâ‚ hâ‚‚ M n,
      nat.find h :=
begin
  unfold rearrangement,
  rw nat.Inf_def (show set.nonempty {k : â„• | k âˆ‰ set.range
    (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement a M â†‘x) âˆ§ 0 â‰¤ a k},
      from exists_nonneg_terms_not_in_range_fin_rearrangement hâ‚ hâ‚‚ M n),
  rw nat.Inf_def (show set.nonempty {k : â„• | k âˆ‰ set.range
    (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement a M â†‘x) âˆ§ a k < 0},
      from exists_neg_terms_not_in_range_fin_rearrangement hâ‚ hâ‚‚ M n),
  simp
end

lemma rearrangement_nonneg {a : â„• â†’ â„}
  (hâ‚ : âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum a) at_top (ğ“ C))
  (hâ‚‚ : Â¬âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum (Î» n, â€–a nâ€–)) at_top (ğ“ C)) {M : â„} {n : â„•}
  (h : âˆ‘ (x : fin (n + 1)) in finset.univ, a (rearrangement a M â†‘x) â‰¤ M)
  : rearrangement a M (n + 1) =
    have h : âˆƒ k, k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement a M â†‘x) âˆ§ 0 â‰¤ a k,
    from exists_nonneg_terms_not_in_range_fin_rearrangement hâ‚ hâ‚‚ M n,
    nat.find h :=
begin
  rw rearrangement_def,
  exact if_pos h
end

lemma rearrangement_neg {a : â„• â†’ â„}
  (hâ‚ : âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum a) at_top (ğ“ C))
  (hâ‚‚ : Â¬âˆƒ C, tendsto (partial_sum (Î» n, â€–a nâ€–)) at_top (ğ“ C)) {M : â„} {n : â„•}
  (h : M < âˆ‘ (x : fin (n + 1)) in finset.univ, a (rearrangement a M â†‘x))
  : rearrangement a M (n + 1) =
    have h : âˆƒ k, k âˆ‰ set.range (Î» x : fin (n + 1), rearrangement a M â†‘x) âˆ§ a k < 0,
    from exists_neg_terms_not_in_range_fin_rearrangement hâ‚ hâ‚‚ M n,
    nat.find h :=
begin
  rw rearrangement_def,
  exact if_neg (by { push_neg, exact h })
end
